titleproper.value: Guide to the Veterans of the Abraham Lincoln Brigade Audio Collection  <num>ALBA.AUDIO.001</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Jennifer Pondo and Gail Malmgreen, 2010

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-08-28T17:30:01</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

unittitle.value: Veterans of the Abraham Lincoln Brigade Audio Collection

abstract.value: U.S. men and woman who had volunteered for service in the Spanish Civil War joined together as the Veterans of the Abraham Lincoln Brigade (VALB) in December 1937 upon their return from Spain. In the 1970s the organization began to collect historical materials from its members, with a view to creating an archive documenting its history.  This general audiotape collection is made up of tapes gathered by VALB over many years. Some items were donated by veterans and their families or by individuals who created them in the course of various projects (conferences, rallies, radio programs, etc.). The collection includes many interviews with individual veterans, tapes of public events, and a series of music tapes.

p.value: Materials are open to researchers. Please contact the Tamiment Library & Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives for more information and to schedule an appointment, tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu or 212-998-2630.
For additional information on the history of VALB see the guide to the Veterans of the Abraham Lincoln Brigade Records, ALBA #19.

The tapes are arranged in three series. <emph render="bold">Series I: Interviews, 1964-2002</emph>; includes interviews with individuals and with small groups and talks presented, for example, in classes; it also includes publicly aired interviews from radio programs. <emph render="bold">Series II: Public Events, 1970-1999</emph>; includes presentations by veterans on trips to Nicaragua and China, live recordings from the veterans' trip to Spain in 1986, and the 50th anniversary celebrations in the Bay area and NYC. <emph render="bold">Series III: Music, 1976-2002</emph>; includes both commercial releases and home recordings by veterans and others. Some of the recordings are tape copies of other recordings, primarily records. Notable is a well executed home recording by Max Parker, of his memories of being a prisoner of war in Spain, which combines narration with song -- possibly a preliminary recording for or an unedited version of material he eventually released on a commercial recording.

corpname.value: Spain. Ejercito Popular de la Republica. Brigada Internacional, XV
